headline: KFin Technologies clocks 25% growth in Q3 profit at Rs 67 crore
content: Domestic mutual fund investor solutions business, which contributed 69 percent to topline, increased 17 percent YoY to Rs 151.5 crore in Q3FY24, KFin Technologies said.

headline: Stockology: Watch for divergence indicators in a volatile trading week
content: The coming week will be volatile; the efficiency of the TimeMap is above 50 percent, which means the movement would be slightly above 3 percent. The bias is in favour of the sellers

headline: Daily Voice | This investment professional expects no major surprises in budget; pegs on chemical space
content: Arun Chulani remains constructive of the prospects of corporate India.

headline: Market Action | Six IPOs to hit Dalal Street, 10 listings lined up next week
content: Six companies will be raising little more than Rs 500 crore through initial public offerings including one from the mainboard segment and the remaining from SME segment.

headline: Bulls likely to back HDFC Bank, Greaves Cotton, Rain Industries for return up to 21% in short term
content: Expert anticipates a strong rebound in the Nifty Bank index during the February 2024 derivative series if the 45,000–44,000 support holds.

headline: Central bank meetings and US economic indicators spark uncertainty in commodity markets
content: Commodity market participants will carefully scrutinize policy guidance by Federal Reserve next week.

headline: Dalal Street Week Ahead | Interim Budget, Fed, auto sales among factors to watch out for
content: Market is likely to be volatile in the event-packed week as the participants will focus on the Interim Budget, Federal Reserve interest rate decision and auto sales for January.

headline: Utkarsh Small Finance Bank Q3 profit jumps 24% to Rs 116 crore
content: As regards asset quality, gross Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) of the bank declined to 3.04 per cent of the gross loans by the end of December 2023 from 3.58 per cent a year ago.

headline: Macrotech Developers Q3 profit up 25% to Rs 505 crore
content: New Delhi, Jan 27  Realty firm Macrotech Developers Ltd on Saturday reported a 25 per cent increase in its consolidated net profit to Rs 505 crore for t..

headline: Budget and Markets: Will the FM spook the F&O party by hiking securities transaction tax?
content: Union Budget 2024: The government expects to collect Rs 27,625 crore from STT in FY24, which is 10.5 percent higher than the revised budget estimate for FY23. However, STT accounts for just about 1.5 percent of the direct tax collection estimate of Rs 18.24 lakh crore.

headline: Yes Bank Q3 Results: Net profit soars 349.7% to Rs 231.6 crore; asset quality stable
content: The bank's gross non-performing assets (NPA) stood at 2.0 percent, no change from 2.0 percent last year.

headline: Spending on Gen AI in Asia-Pacific region to triple to $3.4 bn in 2024, says Infosys Research
content: China leads the region, with investment expected to grow by more than 160% to $2.1 billion, shows the finding from the research arm of Infosys.

headline: Bajaj Finance Q3 Preview: NII to rise 26%, net profit to jump 25% on strong AUM growth
content: An average of four brokerages shows that Bajaj Finance's net interest income is expected to rise 26 percent YoY to Rs 9,344 crore. Stable asset quality and strong AUM (assets under management) growth will drive earnings, as per analysts

headline: Moneycontrol Pro Weekender | The Budget must set the stage for strong long-term growth
content: The government must resist the temptation to be populist in the forthcoming Budget and instead ensure capex-led growth funded by privatisation

headline: Market extends losses but these 31 smallcaps reaped double-digit gains
content: Among broader indices, BSE Midcap, Smallcap and Largecap indices fell 1.6 percent, 0.5 percent and 0.9 percent, respectively.

headline: Weak Intel forecast drags S&P 500, ends streak of record highs
content: The S&P 500 declined 0.07% to end the session at 4,890.97 points. The Nasdaq declined 0.36% to 15,455.36 points, while Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 0.16% to 38,109.43 points.

headline: Market fall continues in second week led by mixed earnings, FII selling
content: On the sectoral front, Nifty Media index shed 10 percent, Nifty Realty index down 4.5 percent, Nifty Bank index fell 2.6 percent, and Nifty PSU Bank index down 2 percent. On the other hand, Nifty Pharma index up 1.7 percent.

headline: Chartist Talks | These 2 stocks, with bullish setup, to generate healthy alpha before and after budget, says this analyst
content: Vinay Rajani of HDFC Securities ruled out possibility of Nifty breaking 20,500 mark.

headline: Daily Voice | Market may complete 10% correction is likely scenario but post budget, says this CIO
content: The road map to increase power through RE (renewable energy) both solar and wind and green hydrogen should emerge as a mega trend for the next few years, says Umeshkumar Mehta.

headline: Bargain hunting made easy with Options: Shubham Agarwal
content: Shubham Agarwal explains a couple of ways to deal with this difficulty by bargain hunting with the help of Options.

headline: Global stock index edges up, dollar falls after U.S. inflation reading
content: U.S. crude was up for the day so far as positive U.S. economic growth and signs of Chinese stimulus boosted demand sentiment, while Middle East supply concerns added further support.

headline: AmEx 4Q profits jump 23% as cardmembers carry heftier balances
content: AmEx had $126 billion in cardmember loans at the end of 2023, up 17% from last year. That resulted in AmEx bringing in $4.91 billion in interest revenue last quarter, up from $3.62 billion a year earlier.

headline: Budget 2024: Renewable energy could add momentum to power stocks
content: Analysts expect higher capital expenditure for renewable energy, incentives for green initiatives, and production-linked incentives for solar module manufacturing.

headline: Budget and Markets: Will the PSU stock rally continue post-budget?
content: Analysts believe that the rally in PSU stocks is likely to extend beyond budget announcements as well, but advised investors to exercise caution as valuations turn rich

headline: Here are 68 stocks that turned multi-baggers from the last Republic Day
content: The big gainers among sectors in the last one year were realty, PSUs, infrastructure, auto, pharma and energy stocks, registering a rally between 38 percent and 100 percent
